errors.blank_rows_guidance_html: Remove the empty row from your CSV file.  If you were not expecting any empty rows then this may indicate a problem with your data
errors.check_options_guidance_html:
Your CSV file appears to only contain a single column. This may indicate that it is being incorrectly parsed.
We recommend using commas as delimiters and escaping values in columns where necessary.
errors.encoding_guidance_html: Your CSV appears to be encoded in <%= encoding %>. We recommend you use UTF-8.
errors.excel_guidance_html: Your CSV file is being delivered without a Content-Type header and has a filename ending in .xls.Check that you are publishing an actual CSV file and not an Excel spreadsheet. Also ensure that the file is delivered with the correct Content-Type.
errors.inconsistent_values_guidance_html: The data in column <%= column %> is inconsistent with others values in the same column.
errors.invalid_encoding_guidance_html: Your CSV appears to be encoded in <%= encoding %>, but invalid characters were found.This can often be caused by copying and pasting data from a different source.
errors.line_breaks_guidance_html: Your CSV has inconsistent line breaks (or your schema specified one line break style and the file uses another). You should make sure all line breaks arein the same form (i.e. CR-LF, or just LF). We recommend using CR-LF for maximum compatibility.
errors.no_content_type_guidance_html:
Your CSV file is being delivered without a Content-Type header.
We recommend that you configure your server to deliver CSV files with a Content-Type header of text/csv; charset=utf-8
errors.no_encoding_guidance_html:
The encoding of your CSV file is not being declared in the HTTP response.
We recommend that you configure your server to deliver CSV files with a Content-Type header of text/csv; charset=utf-8
If you are using a different encoding, then use an appropriate value for the charset parameter.
errors.not_found_html:
There appears to be a problem with the URL you supplied.

Either the file does not exist, or the server is returning an invalid response. Please check your URL and try again.
errors.old_content_type_guidance_html: Note: <%= content_type %> is an old Content Type for CSV that only appeared in a draft RFC. It should no longer be used.
errors.stray_quote_guidance_html:
One or more values in the row have been incorrectly quoted. E.g. a comma has not been escaped, or a quoted field has not been properly escaped
Check the values in the column and ensure that quoting has been correctly applied.
errors.unclosed_quote_guidance_html:
One or more values in the row have been incorrectly quoted. E.g. a comma has not been escaped, or a quoted field has not been properly escaped
Check the values in the column and ensure that quoting has been correctly applied.
errors.ragged_rows_guidance_html:
Row <%= row %> contains a different number of columns to the first row in the CSV file.
This may indicate a problem with the data, e.g. an incorrectly escaped value, or that you are mixing together different tables of information.
errors.unknown_error_guidance_html:
An unexpected error was encountered when trying to parse row <%= row %>. Check the data and ensure that columns are properly formatted.
This problem may also be caused by an invalid character encoding in the data.
errors.s3_upload_guidance_html: Note: It appears that you are using Amazon S3 to deliver your data. You must set the content type of the object when uploading the data to S3 to ensure that it is delivered correctly.
errors.whitespace_guidance_html:
Quoted columns in the CSV should not have any leading or trailing whitespace.
Remove any spaces, tabs or other whitespace from either side of the delimiters in the row.
errors.wrong_content_type_guidance_html:
Your CSV file is being delivered with an incorrect Content-Type of <%= header_content_type %>.
We recommend that you configure your server to deliver CSV files with a Content-Type header of text/csv; charset=utf-8
errors.invalid_schema_guidance_html: We couldn't load the schema you specified. Please make sure you have entered the correct URL, and that it is in JSON Table Schema format.
errors.missing_value_guidance_html: The schema says that a value must be provided in the <%= header %> column. Make sure this column has values in all the rows.
errors.min_length_guidance_html: The schema says that <%= header %> must be at least <%= constraints.min_length %> characters long.
errors.max_length_guidance_html: The schema says that <%= header %> must be at most <%= constraints.max_length %> characters long.
errors.pattern_guidance_html: The schema says that values in <%= header %> must match <%= constraints.pattern %>
errors.header_name_guidance_html: We expected to see the header <%= header %>
errors.malformed_header_guidance_html: We expected to see different values for header columns.
errors.missing_column_guidance_html: There was a missing column on row <%= row %>. Make sure this row includes all the data that should be there.
errors.extra_column_guidance_html: There was an unexpected column on row <%= row %>. Make sure that none of the fields contain commas, are correctly quoted, etc.
errors.unique_guidance_html: Values in the <%= header %> column must be unique.
errors.below_minimum_guidance_html: Values in the <%=header%> column must be <%= constraints.minimum %> or above.
errors.above_maximum_guidance_html: Values in the <%= header %> column must be <%= constraints.maximum %> or below.
errors.non_standard_dialect_guidance_html: Although your CSV validates, to make it as easy as possible for your data to be reused, we recommend using commas as delimiters, double quotes to enclose fields, and autodetecting line endings.
errors.title_row_guidance_html:
Your CSV seems to contain unstructured text at the beginning of the file.
It is important that your CSV only contains structured data - any background information or metadata should be included on a referring web page or accompanying document.
errors.undeclared_header_guidance_html:
There is no machine readable way (either via a schema, or Content-Type header) to tell if your CSV has a header line
Either revalidate this CSV with a schema, or make sure your web server sends the Content-Type of text/csv; header=present or text/csv; header=absent where appropriate.
errors.assumed_header_guidance_html: As there is no machine readable way to tell if your CSV has a header row, we have assumed that your CSV has one.
errors.duplicate_column_name_guidance_html: It looks like the column name in column <%= column %> is duplicated. Please make sure all column names are unique.
